main event: On 15th December 1955, a sighting was reported involving a very large object with steady green and white lights on the rear, emitting a large motor sound and moving slowly for approximately 25 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as having 5 steady green lights and 5 steady white lights on the rear, resembling a B-36 aircraft.
The report suggests it was possibly a balloon, an aircraft, or an astronomical object, with insufficient data for evaluation.
The observation lasted for 25 minutes, indicating a prolonged sighting.
The area was said to be full of traffic all night up until 2200E, suggesting other witnesses may have seen the object as well.
The intelligence officer initially thought it could have been a B-36 or a commercial aircraft with cabin lights on.
result: Possibly a balloon, an aircraft, or an astronomical object, with insufficient data for evaluation
sighted object: Very large object with steady green and white lights on the rear
witnesses: Reported by Lt. Mixon, an intelligence officer
